Module com.cse.ai.othellogame
Package com.cse.ai.othellogame.backend.game

Class Board

java.lang.Object
com.cse.ai.othellogame.backend.game.Board
All Implemented Interfaces:
Cloneable
public class Board extends Object implements Cloneable
Represents the game board for an Othello game.

The board consists of 64 cells arranged in 8x8 grid. Each cell can contain one of the following values:

  • DISK.WHITE for white disc
  • DISK.BLACK for black disc
  • DISK.HINT for hints where to play
  • DISK.EMPTY for empty cell

The initial configuration of the board is as follows:

  • White discs at positions (3,3) and (4,4)
  • Black discs at positions (3,4) and (4,3)
  • Hints for black discs at positions (2,3), (3,2), (4,5), and (5,4)

For the rules of the Othello game, see: Othello Rules

    • forfeitTurn

    • updateBoard

      public void updateBoard(DISK color, int row, int col)
      Called when any player makes a move to update the board with the inserted position.

      Steps:

      1. Check if the position is valid:
        • Ensure the position corresponds to one of the DISK.HINT positions.
        • Ensure the position is within the range of the board.
      2. Delete all old DISK.HINT characters from the board.
      3. Place the new disk at its position, representing the player's move.
      4. Update the other disks on the board according to the insertion position and its color.
      5. Generate new hints for the next move by the opposing player.
      Parameters:
      color - The player who played this turn (DISK.BLACK or DISK.WHITE).
      row - The row index of the inserted position (0-based) (range: [0, 7]).
      col - The column index of the inserted position (0-based) (range: [0, 7]).

    • updateBoard

      public void updateBoard(DISK color, int pos)
      Called when any player makes a move to update the board with the inserted position.

      Steps:

      1. Check if the position is valid:
        • Ensure the position corresponds to one of the DISK.HINT positions.
        • Ensure the position is within the range of the board.
      2. Delete all old DISK.HINT characters from the board.
      3. Place the new disk at its position, representing the player's move.
      4. Update the other disks on the board according to the insertion position and its color.
      5. Generate new hints for the next move by the opposing player.
      Parameters:
      color - The player who played this turn (DISK.BLACK or DISK.WHITE).
      pos - The index of the inserted position (0-based) (range: [0, 63]).

    • updateOtherDisks

      private void updateOtherDisks(DISK player, int row, int col)
      Called after player's move is inserted on the board. Updates disks opposite of inserted disk horizontally, vertically and diagonally. Used in the updateBoard(DISK, int, int) method
      Parameters:
      player - The player who played this turn (DISK.BLACK or DISK.WHITE).
      row - The row index of the inserted position (0-based) (range: [0, 7]).
      col - The column index of the inserted position (0-based) (range: [0, 7]).

    • generateNewHints

      public void generateNewHints(DISK colorToPlay)
      Generates new hints(if there) for the next move by analyzing the current state of the board, and sets the flag true. Used in the updateBoard(DISK, int, int) method.
      Parameters:
      colorToPlay - the next players color (DISK.BLACK or DISK.WHITE)

    • outOfBounds

      private boolean outOfBounds(int r, int c)
      Checks if the given row and column indices are out of bounds of an 8x8 board.
      Parameters:
      r - The row index.
      c - The column index.
      Returns:
      true if the indices are out of bounds, false otherwise.

    • translate

      private boolean translate(int r, int c, int dx, int dy, DISK colorToPlay) throws ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException
      Checks if a move in a specified direction (dx, dy) from a given position (r, c) can be translated into the current player's color.
      Parameters:
      r - The starting row index.
      c - The starting column index.
      dx - The change in row index for each step.
      dy - The change in column index for each step.
      colorToPlay - The color of the current player.
      Returns:
      true if the move can be translated into the current player's color, false otherwise.
      Throws:
      ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if the move results in out-of-bounds access.

      Parameters:

      col - The column index.
      colorToPlay - The color of the current player.
      Returns:
      true if the move is valid for the current player, false otherwise.

    • gameEnded

      public boolean gameEnded()
      Checks if the Othello game has ended.

      This method analyzes the current state of the Othello game board to determine whether the game has ended. The game is considered ended if one of the following conditions is met:

      • No more valid moves are available for either player.
      • The entire board is filled with discs, and no further moves can be made.

      If the game has ended, this method returns true; otherwise, it returns false.
      Note: The winner is determined by the player with more discs of their color on the board at the end of the game, call the getWinner() method to get the color of the winning player.

      Returns:
      true if the Othello game has ended, false otherwise.

    • getWinner

      public char getWinner()
      Gets the winner of the Othello game.

      This method determines and returns the winner of the Othello game based on the scores of the white and black players. The player with the higher score is declared the winner. If the scores are equal, the game is considered a tie.

      Returns:
      The color of the winning player (DISK.WHITE for white, DISK.BLACK for black, 'T' for tie).

    • getWhiteScore

      public int getWhiteScore()
      Gets the score of the white player.

      This method calculates and returns the score of the white player in the Othello game. The score represents the number of discs (pieces) of the white player currently on the board.

      Returns:
      The score of the white player.

    • getBlackScore

      public int getBlackScore()
      Gets the score of the black player.

      This method calculates and returns the score of the black player in the Othello game. The score represents the number of discs (pieces) of the black player currently on the board.

      Returns:
      The score of the black player.

    • getScore

      public int getScore(DISK color)
      Gets the score of the specified player.

      This method calculates and returns the score of the player specified by the color parameter in the Othello game. The score represents the number of discs (pieces) of the specified player currently on the board.

      Parameters:
      color - The color of the player whose score is to be calculated (DISK.WHITE for white, DISK.BLACK for black).
      Returns:
      The score of the specified player.

    • noHints

      public boolean noHints()
      Checks if there are no hints (valid moves) available on the Othello game board.

      This method iterates through all cells on the game board to determine if any of them contain a hint, indicating a valid move for the current player.

      If no hints are found on the board, meaning no valid moves are available, the method returns true; otherwise, it returns false.

      Returns:
      true if there are no hints (valid moves) available on the game board, false otherwise.

    • isFilled

      public boolean isFilled()
